Trump says Israel, Hamas agree to first phase of peace plan
Subhead: 'I am very proud to announce that Israel and Hamas have both signed off on the first phase of our peace plan,' Trump said Wednesday on his Truth Social network. The initial agreement was confirmed by Israeli officials and Hamas, as well as mediator Qatar.

Title: During the Vendée Globe, sailor Charlie Dalin 'didn't think much' about his cancer: '[I]was happy at sea'
Subhead: In 'La Force du destin' ('The Force of Destiny'), released on Thursday, the skipper −  who won January's solo, nonstop, round-the-world race without outside assistance − reveals that he competed while undergoing treatment for a gastrointestinal stromal tumor.

Title: A spa day at home, an erotic utopia to explore
Subhead: What if sex could be as soothing and wellness-oriented as a day at the spa? Maïa Mazaurette, a columnist for Le Monde, explores this dreamy scenario.

Title: Pierre Serna, historian: 'Macron is in complete denial of his responsibility'
Subhead: The historian analyzes the current crisis in French politics through the lens of an oxymoron he coined: the 'extreme center,' where moderation leads to chaos.

Matthieu Blazy: 'Just because Karl was a legend does not mean that everyone who designs for Chanel has to be one too'
Subhead: The anticipation was overwhelming. But on Monday, the first show by Chanel's new artistic director under the glass roof of the Grand Palais lived up to all expectations. With his impeccable CV and strong personality, the 41-year-old designer has written the first page of a new chapter for the fashion house. His mission? To usher it into a new era without losing its soul.

Title: What's next for France? Six questions to understand the political crisis
Subhead: The resignation of Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu ushers in a new period of political instability, though the Constitution, the law and republican tradition provide for the country to continue to function.

Title: Two years after October 7, many French Jews have chosen silence: 'We're made to feel that we're on the wrong side'
Subhead: Since the Hamas terrorist attack in Israel, faced with an 'outside world' perceived as hostile or incapable of understanding them, many Jews have chosen to avoid discussing current events and say they are tempted to withdraw from society.
